passages.name: Untitled Passage
passages.text: You are a wandering sage in ancient Bharat, traveling through the forests when you encounter a crucial moral decision...

passages.name: scene 2
passages.text:
You walk through a dense forest, the scent of sandalwood thick in the air. Suddenly, you hear desperate footsteps‚Äîsomeone running. A young villager stumbles into your path, gasping.
"Please! A bandit is after me!" they plead.

links.linkText: Hide the villager in the trees
Stand your ground and face the bandit

passages.name: Hide

links.linkText: Lie and say no one came this way
Tell the truth and point to the tree

passages.text:
You quickly point to the hollow of an ancient tree. The villager hides just as the bandit appears, eyes scanning the area.
"Have you seen someone run this way?" he growls.

passages.name: Confront

links.linkText: Challenge him to a duel of wits

passages.text:
You plant your staff firmly in the ground. "Violence breeds only suffering," you warn. The bandit hesitates.
"I seek what is mine!" he growls.

passages.name: Question
passages.text: Who are you? Why is he after you?

passages.name: Lie
passages.text: "No, traveler, I have seen no one," you say calmly. The bandit frowns, grunts, and walks away.

passages.name: Truth
passages.text: You point toward the tree, and the bandit's lips curl into a smirk. He drags the villager away.

passages.name: scene 3
passages.text: The villager emerges, bowing deeply. "Thank you, wise one. I shall never forget this."

passages.name: scene 5
passages.text: Later, guilt gnaws at you. Was it truly righteous to tell the truth at the cost of another‚Äôs life?

passages.name: scene 6
passages.text: You have upheld honesty, but at what cost?

passages.name: Wisdom
passages.text:
You share a parable of greed and consequence. The bandit, touched, sighs. "Perhaps I have lost my way..." He drops his sword and walks into the forest, a changed man.

üïä A kind word turned away wrath.

passages.name: Duel

links.linkText: You won, but at what cost?

passages.text: You kill the man and save the villager's life

passages.name: scene 8
passages.text: The attacker catches up and finishes the job
